title: Abstract syntax tree
synopsis: In computer science, an abstract syntax tree (AST), or just syntax tree, is a tree representation of the abstract syntactic structure of source code written in a programming language. Each node of the tree denotes a construct occurring in the source code. The syntax is "abstract" in not representing every detail appearing in the real syntax - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Abstract_syntax_tree wikipedia]
